marketNews.title: Government Plans to Amend Minerba Royalty Rates
marketNews.content:
The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources on Saturday (8/3) held a public consultation regarding the draft amendment to mineral and coal (minerba) royalties. In the draft (see table), the government will increase the royalty rate for several mineral commodities, such as nickel, copper, and gold. Meanwhile, for coal commodities, the government plans to adjust the royalty rate and non-tax state revenue (PNBP) as follows:
- IUP Contracts: Royalty rate increases by +1 percentage point for coal with calorific value ≤4,200 and >4,200-5,200 when the Reference Coal Price (HBA) ≥90 US dollars per ton, becoming 9% and 11.5% respectively.
- PKP2B Contracts: Royalty rate increases by +1 percentage point for coal with calorific value ≤4,200 and >4,200-5,200 when the Reference Coal Price (HBA) ≥90 US dollars per ton, becoming 9% and 11.5% respectively. Furthermore, Mining Revenue Share (PHT) for the same calorific value and HBA decreases by -1 percentage point, becoming 4.5% and 2% respectively.
- IUPK Contracts (extension from PKP2B): The royalty rate range is changed. The government also plans to adjust the corporate income tax (PPh) rate for companies with IUPK contracts from 22% to align with corporate income tax regulations.

Key Takeaway
If ratified, we assess this proposal has the potential to suppress the performance of coal producer issuers operating under IUP permits such as Bukit Asam ($PTBA) and PKP2B such as Indo Tambangraya Megah ($ITMG). Additionally, the increase in royalty rates for metal commodities also has the potential to suppress the performance of mineral producer issuers, such as Vale Indonesia ($INCO), Trimegah Bangun Persada ($NCKL), Aneka Tambang ($ANTM), Bumi Resources Minerals ($BRMS), and Amman Mineral Internasional ($AMMN).
Based on the adjustment plan above, the commodities that will experience the highest royalty increase are copper ore and ferronickel. With a Reference Mineral Price (HMA) for copper of 9,362 US dollars per ton in March 2025, the royalty for copper ore has the potential to triple from 5% to 15%, while the royalty for ferronickel increases by +150% from 2% to 5%.
Meanwhile, for coal producers operating under IUPK contracts, we assess that the discourse on adjusting the PNBP rate range has the potential to boost the related issuer's performance, considering the HBA as of March 2025 is 128 US dollars per ton. Coal producer issuers operating under IUPK contracts are Bumi Resources ($BUMI), Indika Energy ($INDY), and Adaro Andalan Indonesia ($AADI).

*This article was released in Stockbit Commentary on Monday (10/3) morning.

tickerNews.title: RAJA: Target Acquisition of 2 Companies Completed in 1H25
tickerNews.content: $RAJA: President Director of Rukun Raharja, Djauhar Maulidi, said on Friday (7/3) that the company is reviewing the plan to acquire 2 companies, with both targeted for completion in 1H25. Djauhar did not mention the identity of the companies to be acquired nor the costs required to execute the corporate action, but he stated that the 2 companies operate in the gas distribution and LNG infrastructure sectors. This acquisition is the company's effort to develop its midstream and downstream sector businesses.

tickerNews.title: TPIA: Prajogo Pangestu Sells 23.2 Million Shares for Free Float Increase
tickerNews.content: $TPIA: The controller of Chandra Asri Pacific, Prajogo Pangestu, sold 23.2 million TPIA shares at an average price of 7,207 rupiah per share from March 3-7, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~167 billion rupiah and was intended to increase the free float. After this transaction, Prajogo Pangestu's direct ownership in TPIA decreased from 5.06% to 5.03%.

tickerNews.title: DATA: Controller Verah Wahyudi S. Wong Net Sold 20.9 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: $DATA: The controller and President Commissioner of Remala Abadi, Verah Wahyudi S. Wong, net sold 20.9 million DATA shares at an average price of 1,890 rupiah per share on March 5, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~39.5 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Verah Wahyudi S. Wong's ownership in DATA decreased from 83.57% to 82.08%.

tickerNews.title: HILL: Controller PT Hillcon Equity Management Sold Approximately 66 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: $HILL: The controller of Hillcon, PT Hillcon Equity Management, sold approximately 66 million HILL shares at a price of 2,500 rupiah per share on March 4, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~165 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Hillcon Equity Management's ownership in HILL decreased from 61.76% to 59.52%.

tickerNews.title: DRMA: Commissioner Noel Aelyo Laras Kusuma Negara Bought 7 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: $DRMA: Commissioner of Dharma Polimetal, Noel Aelyo Laras Kusuma Negara, purchased 7 million DRMA shares at a price of 670 rupiah per share on March 5, 2025. The total transaction value was ~4.7 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Noel Aelyo Laras Kusuma Negara's ownership in DRMA increased from 1.419% to 1.566%.

tickerNews.title: PADI: PT Sentosa Bersama Mitra Plans Voluntary Tender Offer for 50% of Shares
tickerNews.content: $PADI: PT Sentosa Bersama Mitra plans to conduct a voluntary tender offer for 5.65 billion (50%) shares of Minna Padi Investama Sekuritas from April 16, 2025, to May 15, 2025. The tender offer price is 13 rupiah per share - which is -66% lower compared to the PADI share price on Monday (10/3) at the level of 39 rupiah per share - resulting in a maximum transaction value for this corporate action reaching 73.5 billion rupiah. PT Sentosa Bersama Mitra is controlled by Hapsoro. Previously, PT Sentosa Bersama Mitra purchased 650 million PADI shares at an average price of 15 rupiah per share on February 19, 2025, which increased its ownership in PADI from none to 5.75%.

tickerNews.title: President Instructs Ride-Hailing Firms GOTO and Grab to Provide Holiday Bonuses (THR)
tickerNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto on Monday (10/3) ordered ride-hailing companies, including GoTo Gojek Tokopedia ($GOTO) and Grab Holdings Ltd. (Nasdaq: GRAB), to provide holiday allowances (THR) to online motorcycle taxi (ojol) drivers. President Prabowo stated that the cash THR for ojol drivers will be calculated based on their work activity, with details to be discussed between the companies and the Ministry of Manpower. President Prabowo claimed that Indonesia has approximately 250,000 ojol and online couriers. Responding to this issue, GOTO said it would provide a cash THR to "eligible driver partners meeting certain criteria," while Grab will calculate it based on "achievements, including the number of orders completed, order completion ratio, number of days and hours online, as well as driver rating."

tickerNews.title: Motorcycle Sales Grow in February 2025, First Annual Growth Since October 2024
tickerNews.content: The Indonesian Motorcycle Industry Association (AISI) noted that domestic motorcycle sales reached 581,277 units in February 2025 (+4% YoY, +3.7% MoM), marking the first annual sales growth since October 2024. This result brought domestic motorcycle sales over 2M25 to approximately 1.1 million units (-0.8% YoY), equivalent to 17-17.8% of AISI's 2025 target set in the range of 6.4-6.7 million units.

tickerNews.title: Malaysian CPO Stocks Hit Nearly Two-Year Low in February 2025
tickerNews.content: The Malaysian Palm Oil Board recorded that Malaysian CPO stocks in February 2025 decreased by -4.31% MoM to 1.51 million tons, marking the fifth consecutive monthly decline and the lowest level since April 2023. Meanwhile, Malaysian CPO production in February 2025 also decreased by -4.16% MoM to 1.19 million tons, the lowest level in the last 3 years as floods disrupted production. Malaysian CPO exports also fell by -16.27% MoM to 1 million tons in February 2025, marking the lowest level in the last 4 years.

tickerNews.title: China Announces Retaliatory Tariffs on Some Canadian Farm and Food Products Effective March 20, 2025
tickerNews.content: The Chinese government announced retaliatory import tariffs on Canadian agricultural and food products effective March 20, 2025. These tariffs will be imposed at 100% on rapeseed oil, oil cakes, and peas commodities, while a 25% tariff will be imposed on aquaculture and pork products. These tariffs are in retaliation for tariffs imposed by Canada on electric vehicles and Chinese-made steel and aluminum products as of October 2024.

tickerNews.title: KPK Highlights Lunch Budget and Governance for Nutritious Meals
tickerNews.content: The Chairman of the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK), Setyo Budianto, stated on Friday (7/3) that the KPK had received reports regarding a reduction in the free lunch budget, from the expected 10,000 rupiah per portion to 8,000 rupiah per portion. Responding to this, the Head of the National Nutrition Agency, Dadan Hindayana, stated that the ceiling for the free lunch budget indeed varies depending on the recipient's age, with children from PAUD up to 3rd grade in most parts of Western Indonesia budgeted at 8,000 rupiah per portion.

tickerNews.title: China's CPI Experienced Deflation of 0.7% YoY in February 2025
tickerNews.content: China's Consumer Price Index (CPI) experienced deflation of 0.7% YoY in February 2025 (vs. Jan 2025: 0.5% YoY inflation), which was worse than consensus expectations projecting 0.5% YoY deflation. This result marks the first consumer deflation since January 2024 as seasonal demand faded after the Spring Festival at the end of January. On a monthly basis, China's CPI experienced deflation of 0.2% MoM (vs. Jan 2025: 0.7% MoM inflation), worse than consensus expectations projecting 0.1% MoM deflation, marking the first decline since November 2024. Meanwhile, China recorded core deflation of 0.1% YoY in February 2025 (vs. Jan 2025: 0.6% YoY core inflation).

tickerNews.title: China's Central Bank Gold Reserves Increased for the Fourth Straight Month in February 2025
tickerNews.content: China's central bank gold reserves were recorded to have increased by 16,000 fine troy ounces to 73.61 million fine troy ounces as of the end of February 2025, marking the fourth consecutive month of gold purchases. As of the end of February 2025, China's gold reserves were valued at 208.64 billion US dollars, up +1.02% MoM.

tickerNews.title: US Non-Farm Payroll Increased by 151,000 Jobs in February 2025, Unemployment Rate Rose to 4.1%
tickerNews.content: The US Bureau of Labor Statistics recorded that non-farm payroll increased by 151,000 jobs in February 2025 (vs. Jan 2025: 125,000 jobs), lower than consensus expectations of 160,000 jobs. Meanwhile, the US unemployment rate rose to 4.1% in February 2025 (vs. Jan 2025: 4%), slightly exceeding the consensus expectation of 4%.
